p: There are many ways of transmitting ASFV to pig and wild boar populations ( Fig. 1). The main tool preventing the introduction of the ASFV onto a pig farm is well-managed biosecurity. The risk of introducing ASFV depends on the type of farm, the area in which it is located, and the general epidemiological situation of the country ( 3, 40). The levels of biosecurity on individual pig farms vary tremendously in Poland ( 19). In order to effectively protect farms against the virus, many factors should be taken into account, including the epidemiological situation of the country, virus resistance to environmental factors, and transmission routes ( 1, 4, 36). Preventing the introduction of ASFV onto farms involves many procedures to minimise the risk of contact between healthy pigs and contaminated objects and other animals.
